title: JSON schema for configuring a Figma/FigJam plugin built with the Create Figma Plugin toolkit

src.description:
(required)
Path to the main entry point.

handler.description:
(required)
The name of the exported function in the file.

src.description:
(required)
Path to the UI implementation of the plugin command.

handler.description:
(required)
The name of the exported function in the file.

key.description:
(required)
The unique key used to identify the parameter.

name.description:
(optional)
The name of the parameter shown in the Quick Actions search bar. Defaults to the value of the sibling "key" key.

description.description:
(optional)
The description for the parameter shown in the Quick Actions search bar.

allowFreeform.description:
(optional)
Set to `true` to allow any value to be entered for the parameter, not just the values suggested by the plugin command.

optional.description:
(optional)
Set to `true` to make the parameter optional. Optional parameters can only occur at the end of the list of parameters. There must be at least one non-optional parameter.

oneOf.description: A separator between plugins commands in the menu.

name.description:
(required)
The name of the plugin command.

main.description:
(required, unless "menu" is specified)
Path to the main entry point of the plugin command. The main entry point must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

ui.description:
(optional)
Path to the UI implementation of the plugin command (as specified via the sibling "main" key). The UI implementation must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

parameters.description:
(optional)
Defines the list of parameters that the plugin command accepts via Figma’s Quick Actions search bar.

parameterOnly.description:
(optional)
When "parameters" is specified, the default behavior is that the user will be required to input parameters via Figma’s Quick Actions search bar. Set "parameterOnly" to `false` to make parameter input optional.

menu.description:
(required, unless "main" is specified)
Sub-menus can be nested.

api.description:
(optional)
The version of the Figma/FigJam plugin API to use. Defaults to "1.0.0".

widgetApi.description:
(optional)
The version of the FigJam widget API to use. Defaults to "1.0.0".

editorType.description:
(optional)
For specifying the editor that the plugin/widget is intended for. One of ["figma"], ["figjam"], or ["figma", "figjam"]. Defaults to ["figma"].

containsWidget.description:
(optional)
Set to `true` for a FigJam widget. Defaults to `false`.

id.description:
(required to publish the plugin/widget on Figma Community)
The plugin/widget ID. This field can be omitted during development but is required if you want to publish your plugin/widget. Figma will generate a unique ID for you when you first try to publish your plugin/widget; copy and paste that ID here.

main.description:
(required, unless "menu" is specified)
Path to the main entry point of the plugin command or widget. The main entry point must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

ui.description:
(optional)
Path to the UI implementation of the plugin command or widget (as specified via the sibling "main" key). The UI implementation must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

parameters.description:
(optional)
Defines the list of parameters that the plugin command accepts via Figma’s Quick Actions search bar.

parameterOnly.description:
(optional)
When "parameters" is specified, the default behavior is that the user will be required to input parameters via Figma’s Quick Actions search bar. Set "parameterOnly" to `false` to make parameter input optional.

menu.description:
(required, unless "main" is specified)
An array that specifies the commands shown in the plugin’s sub-menu. Each object in the array has the keys "name" (required), "main" (required, unless "main" is specified), "ui" (optional), "parameters" (optional), "parameterOnly" (optional), and "menu" (optional). Use a "-" in the array to specify a separator between commands in the sub-menu.

relaunchButtons.description:
(optional)
An object that specifies the commands that can be set as relaunch buttons. Each key is a `relaunchButtonId`. Each value specifies the relaunch button command, and is an object with the keys "name" (required), "main" (required), "ui" (optional), and "multipleSelection" (optional).

name.description:
(required)
The name of the relaunch button.

main.description:
(required, unless "menu" is specified)
Path to the main entry point of the plugin command. The main entry point must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

ui.description:
(optional)
Path to the UI implementation of the plugin command (as specified via the sibling "main" key). The UI implementation must be the function set as the `default` export of the file. To use a particular named export instead, specify an object with "src" (required) and "handler" (required) keys.

multipleSelection.description:
(optional)
Whether the relaunch button should appear when multiple layers are selected.

permissions.description:
(optional)
For specifying the permissions that the plugin/widget needs access to. One of ["activeusers"], ["currentuser"], or ["activeusers", "currentuser"].

capabilities.description:
(optional)
For specifying the capabilities that the plugin needs access to. At the moment, the only applicable capability is ["textreview"].

enablePrivatePluginApi.description:
(optional)
Set to `true` to allow the use of plugin APIs that are only available to private plugins/widgets.

enableProposedApi.description:
(optional)
Set to `true` to allow the use of Proposed APIs that are only available during development.
